knimeNode.name: Proximity
knimeNode.shortDescription: This node generates a raster proximity

fullDescription.intro: This node takes a list of raster file location in the input table and generates a raster proximity map indicating the distance from the center of each pixel to the center of the nearest pixel identified as a target pixel. Target pixels are those in the source raster for which the raster pixel value is in the set of target pixel values. The output table contains the generated raster file locations.
fullDescription.option: Force the output image bands to have a specific type. Use type names (i.e. Byte, Int16,...)
Select the output format. The default is GeoTIFF (GTiff).
Indicate whether distances generated should be in pixel or georeferenced coordinates
Specify a nodata value to use for the destination proximity raster.
Location of the output folder where your new raster files will be generated.

ports.inPort: The locations of source raster files. The table must contain a "Location" column.
ports.outPort: The locations of generated raster file. It uses "Location" as column header.
